intro: Anthistiria humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
